Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hey! I’ve been okay, just trying to keep up with everything. I did some research on properties like we talked about.
That’s fantastic! How did that go for you?
It was actually really interesting. I found a few listings that seemed promising, and I shared them with my sisters.
That’s a great step forward! How did they respond?
They were excited, and we started discussing potential investment strategies. It felt good to make progress together.
That’s wonderful to hear! Collaboration can really strengthen your bond and your goals. How did that discussion make you feel?
It made me feel motivated. I think we’re really serious about this now.
That’s an incredible feeling! It sounds like you’re building a solid foundation for your future. Have you noticed any shifts in your mood or stress levels since you started this process?
I think I feel a little less stressed, actually. Focusing on this goal gives me something positive to think about.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Physiological Observations

Utterance: That’s a great observation. Focusing on your goals can be a powerful way to channel your energy. Have you been able to maintain your mindfulness practices as well?
Yes! I’ve been using the app regularly, and it’s really helping me stay calm.
That’s excellent! How do you feel when you practice mindfulness?
I feel more centered and less reactive. It’s like I can take a step back instead of just reacting.
That’s a significant improvement! Have you noticed any differences in your interactions with others since you’ve been practicing?
Yes, I’ve tried to be more patient. I’ve had a couple of moments where I would’ve snapped, but I took a breath instead.
That’s a great achievement! It shows you’re applying what you’ve learned. Have there been any specific situations where this has helped?
Yeah, there was a day at work when everything was chaotic. Instead of getting frustrated, I just focused on my tasks one at a time.
That’s a wonderful strategy! It’s all about breaking things down into manageable pieces. How did that feel for you?
It felt empowering. I realized I can handle things without losing my cool.
That’s a powerful realization. It sounds like you’re making significant strides in your personal growth. How has your sleep been lately?
It’s been a bit better! I’ve been sticking to a bedtime routine, and it’s helped me fall asleep faster.
That’s great news! Consistency can really make a difference. Have you noticed any changes in how you feel during the day?
I feel less like a zombie! I have more energy, which is nice.
That’s a big win! It sounds like you’re on the right track. Have you had any opportunities to talk to your family about your feelings regarding your brother?
I finally did! I mentioned it to my sisters, and they were really supportive. It felt good to share.
I’m so glad to hear that! Sharing can often lighten the emotional load. How did that conversation affect you?
It relieved a lot of pressure. I didn’t realize how much I was holding in until I talked about it.
That’s a significant breakthrough. It’s important to have that support system. How do you feel about continuing those conversations with your family?
I think I want to keep it going. It feels good to be open with them.
That’s a great decision. Open communication can strengthen your relationships. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I’ve been thinking about my career path. I love my job, but I wonder if I should be doing something more.
That’s a valid concern. What aspects of your job do you enjoy the most?
I love helping people and being part of the creative process. But sometimes I feel like I want to be more involved in decision-making.
It sounds like you’re craving more responsibility and influence. Have you considered discussing your career aspirations with your boss?
I haven’t, but maybe I should! I just worry they’ll think I’m not grateful for my current position.
It’s understandable to have that concern, but expressing your aspirations shows initiative. It might lead to new opportunities for you.
That makes sense. I’ll think about how to approach that conversation.
Great! Setting goals for your career can be just as important as your personal goals. Would you like to set a specific action step for that?
Yes! I’ll draft an email to my boss this week and ask for a meeting to discuss my role.
That sounds like a solid plan. Remember to focus on your strengths and what you enjoy about your work during that conversation.
I will! Thanks for the encouragement.
You’re welcome! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. Let’s check in on how that goes in our next session.
Sounds good! I appreciate your help.
I’m always here for you. Take care, and I look forward to hearing about your progress!
Bye!
Bye!
